intro: Paranephelium nitidum, commonly known as the glossy leaf fern, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and terrestrial plants with showy inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. Paranephelium nitidum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and ease of care.
